meanings.definition: In an irritating or annoying manner.
meanings.sent1: She tapped her foot irksomely on the floor while waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent2: The loud music played irksomely in the background as she tried to concentrate.
meanings.sent3: The constant buzzing of the fly irksomely interrupted their peaceful picnic.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet echoed irksomely in the empty house, driving him to fix it.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive beeping of the alarm clock irksomely woke her up every morning.

meanings.sent1: The irksomely long line at the grocery store made her late for work.
meanings.sent2: His irksomely loud chewing at the dinner table annoyed everyone around him.
meanings.sent3: The irksomely slow internet connection made online gaming impossible.
meanings.sent4: The irksomely difficult puzzle left her feeling frustrated and defeated.
meanings.sent5: The irksomely persistent salesperson finally convinced him to buy the product.
